awd_titl_txt: Purchase of a Laser System for Photoinitiated Charge        Transfer Studies
awd_abstract_narration: This award in the Inorganic, Bioinorganic, and Organometallic Program supports research on  charge transfer reactions by Dr. D. Paul Rillema of the Chemistry Department, University of  North Carolina at Charlotte.  Complexes, primarily of rhenium, containing light harvesting  chromophores will be synthesized.  Photoexcitation of the chromophore promotes electron  transfer between electron donor and acceptor groups covalently attached to it.  The work will  yield fundamental information on the quenching of photogenerated excited states, and is relevant  to solar energy conversion.  This is a Research at Undergraduate Institutions (RUI) award and  the research will be conducted by undergraduate students.
